page.title: 12The school
page.content: An Interview with Mrs. Chapman Continued In the latter part of the 1970s the school was to have become a First School taking children from five to eight years. Several changes were made to the school for this change, such as the fitting of carpets in the classrooms and the building of indoor toilets, but it has recently been decided to keep the school as a five to eleven Primary School. It has been suggested by the the Norfolk Education Authority that schools with less than sixty childrenshould be closed. Since the school falls into this category then its future is rather uncertain.
